      21             : /**
      22             :  * This class wraps a transaction inside a given C++ scope, guaranteeing that
      23             :  * the transaction will be completed even if you have an exception or
      24             :  * return early.
      25             :  *
      26             :  * A common use is to create an instance with aCommitOnComplete = false (rollback),
      27             :  * then call Commit() on this object manually when your function completes
      28             :  * successfully.
      29             :  *
      30             :  * @note nested transactions are not supported by Sqlite, so if a transaction
      31             :  * is already in progress, this object does nothing.  Note that in this case,
      32             :  * you may not get the transaction type you asked for, and you won't be able
      33             :  * to rollback.
      34             :  *
      35             :  * @param aConnection
      36             :  *        The connection to create the transaction on.
      37             :  * @param aCommitOnComplete
      38             :  *        Controls whether the transaction is committed or rolled back when
      39             :  *        this object goes out of scope.
      40             :  * @param aType [optional]
      41             :  *        The transaction type, as defined in mozIStorageConnection.  Defaults
      42             :  *        to TRANSACTION_DEFERRED.
      43             :  * @param aAsyncCommit [optional]
      44             :  *        Whether commit should be executed asynchronously on the helper thread.
      45             :  *        This is a special option introduced as an interim solution to reduce
      46             :  *        main-thread fsyncs in Places.  Can only be used on main-thread.
      47             :  *
      48             :  *        WARNING: YOU SHOULD _NOT_ WRITE NEW MAIN-THREAD CODE USING THIS!
      49             :  *
      50             :  *        Notice that async commit might cause synchronous statements to fail
      51             :  *        with SQLITE_BUSY.  A possible mitigation strategy is to use
      52             :  *        PRAGMA busy_timeout, but notice that might cause main-thread jank.
      53             :  *        Finally, if the database is using WAL journaling mode, other
      54             :  *        connections won't see the changes done in async committed transactions
      55             :  *        until commit is complete.
      56             :  *
      57             :  *        For all of the above reasons, this should only be used as an interim
      58             :  *        solution and avoided completely if possible.
      59             :  */
      60             : class mozStorageTransaction
      61             : {
      62             : public:
      63           0 :   mozStorageTransaction(mozIStorageConnection* aConnection,
      64             :                         bool aCommitOnComplete,

      67             :     : mConnection(aConnection),
      68             :       mHasTransaction(false),
      69             :       mCommitOnComplete(aCommitOnComplete),
      70             :       mCompleted(false),
      71           0 :       mAsyncCommit(aAsyncCommit)
      72             :   {
      73           0 :     if (mConnection) {
      74           0 :       nsAutoCString query("BEGIN");
      75           0 :       switch(aType) {
      76             :         case mozIStorageConnection::TRANSACTION_IMMEDIATE:
      77           0 :           query.AppendLiteral(" IMMEDIATE");
      78           0 :           break;
      79             :         case mozIStorageConnection::TRANSACTION_EXCLUSIVE:
      80           0 :           query.AppendLiteral(" EXCLUSIVE");
      81           0 :           break;
      82             :         case mozIStorageConnection::TRANSACTION_DEFERRED:
      83           0 :           query.AppendLiteral(" DEFERRED");
      84           0 :           break;
      85             :         default:
      86             :           MOZ_ASSERT(false, "Unknown transaction type");
      87             :       }

      90           0 :       mHasTransaction = NS_SUCCEEDED(mConnection->ExecuteSimpleSQL(query));

      94           0 :   ~mozStorageTransaction()

      96           0 :     if (mConnection && mHasTransaction && !mCompleted) {
      97           0 :       if (mCommitOnComplete) {
      98           0 :         mozilla::DebugOnly<nsresult> rv = Commit();
      99             :         NS_WARNING_ASSERTION(NS_SUCCEEDED(rv),
     100             :                              "A transaction didn't commit correctly");
     101             :       }
     102             :       else {
     103           0 :         mozilla::DebugOnly<nsresult> rv = Rollback();
     104             :         NS_WARNING_ASSERTION(NS_SUCCEEDED(rv),
     105             :                              "A transaction didn't rollback correctly");
     106             :       }
     107             :     }
     108           0 :   }
     109             : 
     110             :   /**
     111             :    * Commits the transaction if one is in progress. If one is not in progress,
     112             :    * this is a NOP since the actual owner of the transaction outside of our
     113             :    * scope is in charge of finally committing or rolling back the transaction.
     114             :    */
     115           0 :   nsresult Commit()
     116             :   {
     117           0 :     if (!mConnection || mCompleted || !mHasTransaction)
     118             :       return NS_OK;
     119           0 :     mCompleted = true;
     120             :

     122             :     // it, thus the transaction might stay open until the next COMMIT.
     123             :     nsresult rv;

     131             :     }

     138             : 
     139             :   /**
     140             :    * Rolls back the transaction if one is in progress. If one is not in progress,
     141             :    * this is a NOP since the actual owner of the transaction outside of our
     142             :    * scope is in charge of finally rolling back the transaction.
     143             :    */
     144           0 :   nsresult Rollback()
     145             :   {
     146           0 :     if (!mConnection || mCompleted || !mHasTransaction)
     147             :       return NS_OK;
     148           0 :     mCompleted = true;
     149             : 
     150             :     // TODO (bug 1062823): from Sqlite 3.7.11 on, rollback won't ever return
     151             :     // a busy error, so this handling can be removed.
     152           0 :     nsresult rv = NS_OK;
     153           0 :     do {
     154           0 :       rv = mConnection->ExecuteSimpleSQL(NS_LITERAL_CSTRING("ROLLBACK"));
     155           0 :       if (rv == NS_ERROR_STORAGE_BUSY)
     156           0 :         (void)PR_Sleep(PR_INTERVAL_NO_WAIT);
     157             :     } while (rv == NS_ERROR_STORAGE_BUSY);
     158             : 
     159           0 :     if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv))
     160           0 :       mHasTransaction = false;
     161             : 
     162           0 :     return rv;
     163             :   }
